nodes.bodyText: @mimosa2 I don't think we need this committed to the code base. I believe you used this for testing?
Agree with @arcturus2, this can probably be omitted
There are lots of these bits of code commented. Is there any reason for this or should they be uncommented?
Can this commented code simply be removed instead?

Firstly what is the reason when the size is greater than 1 you have to use index 1?
Anyway an optimisation could be as follows though it may be difficult to read:
parameter.setStringValue(booleanInputRecentValues.get(booleanInputRecentValues.size() > 1? 1 : 0));

Other *InputPane classes have the same pattern going on so perhaps they could all be changed or perhaps a new utility class could be used to hold this logic?
@mimosa2 so these set*Value calls was in the original plugin which I think you commented for testing and they are now removed. Are you able to restore the set value calls?
Restored the set value calls.

This if-else can be converted to a tertiary statement:
RecentParameterValues.storeRecentValue(id, !typeValue.contains("LocalDateParameterType") ? value : obj.toString())
final
can remove this comment
these comments can also be removed
This field isn't being used so can probably be removed
Can change this if-else to tertiary statement: parameter.setStringValue(recentValues.get(recentValues.size() > 1 ? 1 : 0))
final
if-else can be converted to tertiary (similar to suggestion for ColorInputPane)
final
if-else can be converted to tertiary (similar to suggestion for ColorInputPane)
